when_to_say: When referring to a close friend
example: Exemplo 1: João é meu amigo. (João is my friend.)

when_to_say: When talking about a home or building
example: Exemplo 2: Eu moro em uma casa grande. (I live in a big house.)

when_to_say: When talking about running or moving quickly
example: Exemplo 3: Eu gosto de correr todos os dias. (I like to run every day.)

when_to_say: When expressing happiness
example: Exemplo 4: Estou muito feliz hoje! (I'm very happy today!)

when_to_say: When talking about books
example: Exemplo 5: Eu estou lendo um livro interessante. (I'm reading an interesting book.)

when_to_say: When talking about eating
example: Exemplo 6: Eu vou comer pizza hoje. (I will eat pizza today.)

when_to_say: When referring to the drink coffee
example: Exemplo 7: Eu adoro café pela manhã. (I love coffee in the morning.)

when_to_say: When referring to a school or educational institution
example: Exemplo 8: A minha escola é grande. (My school is big.)

when_to_say: When talking about working
example: Exemplo 9: Eu trabalho no escritório. (I work at the office.)

when_to_say: When talking about affection or love
example: Exemplo 10: Eu amo minha família. (I love my family.)

when_to_say: When describing something that is beautiful
example: Exemplo 11: O pôr do sol é bonito. (The sunset is beautiful.)

when_to_say: When talking about speaking
example: Exemplo 12: Eu falo português. (I speak Portuguese.)

when_to_say: When talking about a farm or ranch
example: Exemplo 13: A fazenda tem muitos animais. (The farm has many animals.)

when_to_say: When referring to fruits
example: Exemplo 14: Eu gosto de frutas frescas. (I like fresh fruits.)

when_to_say: When referring to a city
example: Exemplo 15: São Paulo é uma cidade grande. (São Paulo is a big city.)

when_to_say: When referring to a cat
example: Exemplo 16: O gato está dormindo. (The cat is sleeping.)

when_to_say: When referring to a path or road
example: Exemplo 17: Eu vou pelo caminho certo. (I go down the right path.)

when_to_say: When talking about taking a bath
example: Exemplo 18: Eu vou tomar um banho. (I will take a bath.)

when_to_say: When describing someone or something as loving
example: Exemplo 19: Ele é muito amoroso. (He is very loving.)

when_to_say: When referring to the night time
example: Exemplo 20: A noite é tranquila. (The night is peaceful.)

when_to_say: When referring to the sun
example: Exemplo 21: O sol está brilhando. (The sun is shining.)

when_to_say: When referring to water
example: Exemplo 22: Eu preciso de água. (I need water.)

when_to_say: When talking about a beach
example: Exemplo 23: Eu vou para a praia no verão. (I go to the beach in the summer.)

when_to_say: When talking about life or living somewhere
example: Exemplo 24: Eu vivo em Lisboa. (I live in Lisbon.)

when_to_say: When referring to one's place of residence
example: Exemplo 25: Eu moro no Brasil. (I live in Brazil.)

when_to_say: When referring to the act of crying
example: Exemplo 26: Ela chorou muito ontem. (She cried a lot yesterday.)

when_to_say: When talking about war or conflict
example: Exemplo 27: A guerra é devastadora. (War is devastating.)

when_to_say: When referring to soccer/football
example: Exemplo 28: Eu adoro jogar futebol. (I love playing football.)

when_to_say: When describing the color yellow
example: Exemplo 29: O sol é amarelo. (The sun is yellow.)

when_to_say: When referring to running or jogging
example: Exemplo 30: Eu corro todos os dias. (I run every day.)

when_to_say: When talking about cooking
example: Exemplo 31: Eu gosto de cozinhar comida italiana. (I like to cook Italian food.)

when_to_say: When talking about a trip or journey
example: Exemplo 32: Eu estou planejando uma viagem para a Europa. (I am planning a trip to Europe.)

when_to_say: When referring to a city
example: Exemplo 33: A cidade é muito bonita. (The city is very beautiful.)

when_to_say: When referring to writing
example: Exemplo 34: Eu escrevi uma carta. (I wrote a letter.)

when_to_say: When talking about a car or vehicle
example: Exemplo 35: Eu comprei um carro novo. (I bought a new car.)

when_to_say: When referring to the sky
example: Exemplo 36: O céu está limpo hoje. (The sky is clear today.)

when_to_say: When talking about waiting
example: Exemplo 37: Eu vou esperar por você. (I will wait for you.)

when_to_say: When referring to the summer season
example: Exemplo 38: O verão é muito quente. (Summer is very hot.)

when_to_say: When referring to something being true or factual
example: Exemplo 39: A verdade é sempre importante. (The truth is always important.)

when_to_say: When talking about freedom or independence
example: Exemplo 40: A liberdade é um direito fundamental. (Freedom is a fundamental right.)

when_to_say: When referring to understanding something
example: Exemplo 41: Eu compreendo o que você está dizendo. (I understand what you are saying.)

when_to_say: When describing someone or something as independent
example: Exemplo 42: Ela é uma mulher independente. (She is an independent woman.)

when_to_say: When talking about making something more complicated
example: Exemplo 43: Não complique as coisas. (Don't complicate things.)

when_to_say: When referring to challenging someone or something
example: Exemplo 44: Ele desafiou a sua coragem. (He challenged his courage.)

when_to_say: When talking about new ideas or technological advancement
example: Exemplo 45: A inovação é chave para o sucesso. (Innovation is key to success.)

when_to_say: When talking about taking responsibility for something
example: Exemplo 46: A responsabilidade é um valor importante. (Responsibility is an important value.)

when_to_say: When referring to a way of viewing something or a viewpoint
example: Exemplo 47: Cada pessoa tem sua própria perspectiva. (Each person has their own perspective.)

when_to_say: When describing something or someone as powerful
example: Exemplo 48: O governo tem um poderoso impacto na economia. (The government has a powerful impact on the economy.)

when_to_say: When referring to the relationship between friends
example: Exemplo 49: A amizade é o maior tesouro. (Friendship is the greatest treasure.)

when_to_say: When talking about the state of being happy
example: Exemplo 50: A felicidade está nas pequenas coisas. (Happiness is in the small things.)

when_to_say: When referring to trust or confidence in someone or something
example: Exemplo 51: A confiança é essencial em um relacionamento. (Trust is essential in a relationship.)

when_to_say: When talking about understanding something or someone
example: Exemplo 52: A compreensão mútua é crucial. (Mutual understanding is crucial.)

when_to_say: When talking about unity or support among individuals or groups
example: Exemplo 53: A solidariedade é fundamental para a sociedade. (Solidarity is fundamental for society.)

when_to_say: When referring to the ability to recover from difficulties
example: Exemplo 54: A resiliência nos ajuda a superar desafios. (Resilience helps us overcome challenges.)

when_to_say: When describing someone who takes responsibility for their actions
example: Exemplo 55: Ele é uma pessoa muito responsável. (He is a very responsible person.)

when_to_say: When talking about intense excitement or eagerness
example: Exemplo 56: Seu entusiasmo é contagiante. (His enthusiasm is contagious.)

when_to_say: When referring to something in balance or harmony
example: Exemplo 57: A vida precisa de equilíbrio. (Life needs balance.)

when_to_say: When referring to the desire to learn or know more
example: Exemplo 58: A curiosidade leva ao conhecimento. (Curiosity leads to knowledge.)

when_to_say: When describing someone with high mental ability
example: Exemplo 59: Ela é muito inteligente. (She is very intelligent.)

when_to_say: When referring to the ability to understand and share feelings
example: Exemplo 60: A empatia é essencial em relações humanas. (Empathy is essential in human relationships.)

when_to_say: When talking about a difficult or demanding task
example: Exemplo 61: Enfrentar um desafio é crescer. (Facing a challenge is to grow.)

when_to_say: When talking about continuous effort despite difficulty
example: Exemplo 62: A persistência é chave para o sucesso. (Persistence is key to success.)

when_to_say: When referring to a deep awareness of the suffering of others
example: Exemplo 63: Ela demonstra grande compaixão pelos outros. (She shows great compassion for others.)

when_to_say: When describing something that is complicated or intricate
example: Exemplo 64: A complexidade deste problema é alta. (The complexity of this problem is high.)

when_to_say: When talking about showing consideration for someone or something
example: Exemplo 65: O respeito é fundamental em qualquer relação. (Respect is fundamental in any relationship.)

when_to_say: When referring to the introduction of new ideas or methods
example: Exemplo 66: A inovação é o motor do progresso. (Innovation is the engine of progress.)

when_to_say: When referring to the quality of being genuine or real
example: Exemplo 67: A autenticidade é uma qualidade admirável. (Authenticity is an admirable quality.)

when_to_say: When referring to the ability to make sound decisions based on knowledge and experience
example: Exemplo 68: A sabedoria vem com o tempo. (Wisdom comes with time.)

when_to_say: When talking about the state of being happy or content
example: Exemplo 69: A felicidade está nas pequenas coisas. (Happiness is in the little things.)

when_to_say: When referring to the ability to confront fear or adversity
example: Exemplo 70: A coragem de enfrentar os desafios é admirável. (The courage to face challenges is admirable.)

when_to_say: When referring to the ability to understand something or someone
example: Exemplo 71: A compreensão mútua é importante em qualquer relação. (Mutual understanding is important in any relationship.)

when_to_say: When referring to the act of letting go or not being overly attached to something or someone
example: Exemplo 72: O desapego é uma qualidade de sabedoria. (Detachment is a quality of wisdom.)

when_to_say: When referring to the act of overcoming challenges or adversity
example: Exemplo 73: A superação é o que nos torna mais fortes. (Overcoming is what makes us stronger.)

when_to_say: When referring to focusing one's mind or effort on something
example: Exemplo 74: Preste atenção ao que você está fazendo. (Pay attention to what you're doing.)

when_to_say: When referring to the ability to adapt or change when necessary
example: Exemplo 75: A flexibilidade é crucial para o sucesso. (Flexibility is crucial for success.)

when_to_say: When referring to the ability to recover quickly from difficulties
example: Exemplo 76: A resiliência é uma característica importante em tempos difíceis. (Resilience is an important trait in tough times.)

when_to_say: When referring to unity or agreement of feeling or action
example: Exemplo 77: A solidariedade entre as pessoas fortalece a comunidade. (Solidarity among people strengthens the community.)

when_to_say: When referring to the quality of having experience, knowledge, and good judgment
example: Exemplo 78: A sabedoria vem com o tempo. (Wisdom comes with time.)

when_to_say: When referring to the organ that pumps blood or metaphorically to emotions or love
example: Exemplo 79: O coração bate forte quando estamos nervosos. (The heart beats fast when we are nervous.)

when_to_say: When talking about stability or mental composure
example: Exemplo 80: Manter o equilíbrio é essencial para o bem-estar. (Maintaining balance is essential for well-being.)

when_to_say: When referring to the state of being free or unrestricted
example: Exemplo 81: A liberdade é um direito fundamental. (Freedom is a fundamental right.)

when_to_say: When referring to a difficult task or situation that requires effort to overcome
example: Exemplo 82: O maior desafio da vida é encontrar a felicidade. (The greatest challenge in life is finding happiness.)

when_to_say: When talking about forward movement or improvement
example: Exemplo 83: Estamos fazendo progressos na nossa jornada. (We are making progress in our journey.)

when_to_say: When referring to the state of being self-sufficient and not dependent on others
example: Exemplo 84: A independência é importante para um país. (Independence is important for a country.)

when_to_say: When referring to a promise or dedication to a cause or responsibility
example: Exemplo 85: O compromisso com o trabalho é fundamental para o sucesso. (Commitment to work is fundamental for success.)

when_to_say: When referring to the ability to wait calmly without getting frustrated
example: Exemplo 86: A paciência é uma virtude. (Patience is a virtue.)

when_to_say: When referring to admiration or regard for someone or something
example: Exemplo 87: O respeito mútuo é essencial em qualquer relação. (Mutual respect is essential in any relationship.)

when_to_say: When referring to the introduction of new ideas, methods, or products
example: Exemplo 88: A inovação é a chave para o sucesso nos negócios. (Innovation is the key to success in business.)

when_to_say: When referring to the bond between friends or companions
example: Exemplo 89: A amizade verdadeira é rara. (True friendship is rare.)

when_to_say: When referring to mutual support and unity, especially in difficult situations
example: Exemplo 90: A solidariedade é crucial durante crises. (Solidarity is crucial during crises.)

when_to_say: When referring to the ability to understand something or someone
example: Exemplo 91: A compreensão mútua é essencial para um bom relacionamento. (Mutual understanding is essential for a good relationship.)

when_to_say: When referring to belief in the reliability, truth, or ability of someone or something
example: Exemplo 92: Confiança é a base de qualquer amizade. (Trust is the foundation of any friendship.)

when_to_say: When referring to the quality of being determined or resolute in achieving something
example: Exemplo 93: A determinação é o que nos leva a alcançar nossos objetivos. (Determination is what leads us to achieve our goals.)

when_to_say: When referring to the act of overcoming obstacles or difficulties
example: Exemplo 94: A superação de dificuldades nos fortalece. (Overcoming difficulties makes us stronger.)

when_to_say: When referring to the ability to understand and share the feelings of another
example: Exemplo 95: A empatia é fundamental para ajudar os outros. (Empathy is essential for helping others.)

when_to_say: When referring to achieving victory or gaining something through effort
example: Exemplo 96: Ele conquistou a confiança de todos. (He won everyone's trust.)

when_to_say: When referring to the ability to recover quickly from difficulties or adversity
example: Exemplo 97: A resiliência é uma qualidade necessária para superar desafios. (Resilience is a necessary quality to overcome challenges.)

when_to_say: When referring to the quality of having experience, knowledge, and good judgment
example: Exemplo 98: A sabedoria vem com o tempo e a experiência. (Wisdom comes with time and experience.)

when_to_say: When referring to a feeling of great happiness or pleasure
example: Exemplo 99: Ela sentiu muita alegria ao receber a notícia. (She felt a lot of joy upon receiving the news.)

when_to_say: When referring to the act of presenting a difficult situation or test to someone
example: Exemplo 100: O professor desafiou os alunos com um exercício difícil. (The teacher challenged the students with a difficult exercise.)

when_to_say: When referring to the willingness to give to others without expecting anything in return
example: Exemplo 101: Sua generosidade é admirável. (His generosity is admirable.)

when_to_say: When referring to the introduction of something new or the process of changing or improving
example: Exemplo 102: A inovação é fundamental para o sucesso das empresas. (Innovation is essential for the success of businesses.)

when_to_say: When referring to a dramatic change or the overthrow of a system or structure
example: Exemplo 103: A revolução tecnológica mudou o mundo. (The technological revolution changed the world.)

when_to_say: When referring to the quality of being unbiased and fair in judgment
example: Exemplo 104: O juiz mostrou imparcialidade durante o julgamento. (The judge showed impartiality during the trial.)

when_to_say: When referring to the quality of being genuine or real
example: Exemplo 105: A autenticidade é fundamental para um relacionamento verdadeiro. (Authenticity is essential for a true relationship.)

when_to_say: When referring to the ability to produce the intended result or effect
example: Exemplo 106: A eficácia das medidas tomadas foi comprovada. (The effectiveness of the measures taken was proven.)

when_to_say: When referring to the state of being limited to a particular group or individual
example: Exemplo 107: O acesso ao evento era por convite e tinha exclusividade. (Access to the event was by invitation and had exclusivity.)

when_to_say: When referring to the ability to make good judgments and decisions based on knowledge and experience
example: Exemplo 108: A sabedoria do ancião ajudou a resolver o conflito. (The wisdom of the elder helped resolve the conflict.)

when_to_say: When referring to a state of joy or contentment
example: Exemplo 109: A felicidade dela era contagiante. (Her happiness was contagious.)

when_to_say: When referring to the act of causing someone to feel let down or unsatisfied
example: Exemplo 110: O filme me desapontou, esperava mais. (The movie disappointed me, I expected more.)

when_to_say: When describing something extremely good or impressive
example: Exemplo 111: O jantar foi maravilhoso! (The dinner was wonderful!)

when_to_say: When describing someone or something that requires a lot of effort or attention
example: Exemplo 112: O chefe é muito exigente com os prazos. (The boss is very demanding with deadlines.)

when_to_say: When referring to someone who is careful and avoids risk
example: Exemplo 113: Ele foi cauteloso ao tomar a decisão. (He was cautious when making the decision.)

when_to_say: When referring to a deep feeling of dislike or aversion
example: Exemplo 114: Ela sentiu uma antipatia imediata por ele. (She felt an immediate antipathy towards him.)

when_to_say: When referring to the state of being accountable or having a duty
example: Exemplo 115: A responsabilidade de liderar o projeto é enorme. (The responsibility of leading the project is huge.)

when_to_say: When describing someone who is not willing to change or compromise
example: Exemplo 116: O chefe foi intransigente nas negociações. (The boss was inflexible in the negotiations.)

when_to_say: When referring to the process of creating or improving something over time
example: Exemplo 117: A empresa está desenvolvendo um novo produto. (The company is developing a new product.)

when_to_say: When referring to the act of making others aware or conscious of an issue or situation
example: Exemplo 118: Precisamos conscientizar a população sobre a importância da reciclagem. (We need to raise awareness among the population about the importance of recycling.)

when_to_say: When referring to the bond between friends
example: Exemplo 119: A amizade verdadeira é rara. (True friendship is rare.)

when_to_say: When referring to an exciting or unusual experience
example: Exemplo 120: Eles viajaram para a montanha em busca de aventura. (They traveled to the mountain in search of adventure.)

when_to_say: When referring to the ability to confront fear or adversity
example: Exemplo 121: Ela teve coragem de falar em público. (She had the courage to speak in public.)

when_to_say: When referring to something that produces the desired result
example: Exemplo 122: A estratégia foi eficaz para aumentar as vendas. (The strategy was effective in increasing sales.)

when_to_say: When referring to something that is absolutely necessary
example: Exemplo 123: O acesso à educação é imprescindível para o progresso. (Access to education is indispensable for progress.)

when_to_say: When describing something that is shallow or lacking depth
example: Exemplo 124: A análise foi superficial e não entrou em detalhes. (The analysis was superficial and did not go into details.)

when_to_say: When describing a deep sadness or sorrow
example: Exemplo 125: A melancolia tomou conta dele após a perda. (The melancholy took over him after the loss.)

when_to_say: When referring to a character who opposes or competes with the protagonist
example: Exemplo 126: O antagonista do filme era muito astuto. (The antagonist in the movie was very clever.)

when_to_say: When referring to the introduction of something new or innovative
example: Exemplo 127: A inovação tecnológica está mudando o mercado. (Technological innovation is changing the market.)

when_to_say: When describing something that is extremely impressive or stunning
example: Exemplo 128: A vista do topo da montanha era deslumbrante. (The view from the top of the mountain was dazzling.)

when_to_say: When referring to the ability to make good judgments based on knowledge and experience
example: Exemplo 129: A sabedoria vem com a experiência. (Wisdom comes with experience.)

when_to_say: When referring to a strong desire or intention
example: Exemplo 130: Tenho vontade de viajar para a praia. (I have the desire to travel to the beach.)

when_to_say: When referring to compassion or forgiveness shown towards someone
example: Exemplo 131: Ele pediu misericórdia por seus erros. (He asked for mercy for his mistakes.)

when_to_say: When describing something that arouses curiosity or interest
example: Exemplo 132: O mistério do livro é muito intrigante. (The mystery of the book is very intriguing.)

when_to_say: When describing something that is difficult or requires a lot of effort
example: Exemplo 133: O trabalho foi muito desafiante. (The task was very challenging.)

when_to_say: When referring to a situation or statement that is unclear or open to more than one interpretation
example: Exemplo 134: A ambiguidade da resposta deixou todos confusos. (The ambiguity of the answer left everyone confused.)

when_to_say: When describing someone or something that is able to convince others to believe or do something
example: Exemplo 135: O vendedor foi muito persuasivo. (The salesman was very persuasive.)

when_to_say: When referring to something that is not clearly defined or has no clear boundaries
example: Exemplo 136: A resposta foi indefinida e vaga. (The answer was undefined and vague.)

when_to_say: When referring to something that is direct and forceful, often harsh
example: Exemplo 137: Sua resposta foi contundente e sem rodeios. (His response was blunt and straightforward.)

when_to_say: When referring to something that exists only in the imagination, not real
example: Exemplo 138: O dragão é uma criatura imaginária. (The dragon is an imaginary creature.)

when_to_say: When expressing gratitude or recognizing value in something
example: Exemplo 139: Eu tenho muita apreciação pela sua ajuda. (I have great appreciation for your help.)

when_to_say: When describing the feeling of trust or self-assurance
example: Exemplo 140: Ela tem muita confiança no seu trabalho. (She has a lot of confidence in her work.)

when_to_say: When referring to the quality of being genuine or real
example: Exemplo 141: Ele sempre busca a autenticidade nas suas ações. (He always seeks authenticity in his actions.)

when_to_say: When referring to the consequence or result of an action or statement
example: Exemplo 142: As implicações dessa decisão podem ser sérias. (The implications of this decision can be serious.)

when_to_say: When describing something or someone that is extraordinary or above average
example: Exemplo 143: Ela tem um talento excepcional para a música. (She has an exceptional talent for music.)

when_to_say: When describing someone who is unwilling to change their views or opinions
example: Exemplo 144: O chefe foi intransigente em sua decisão. (The boss was intransigent in his decision.)

when_to_say: When referring to the ability to anticipate and act ahead of time, rather than reacting to events
example: Exemplo 145: A proatividade dele ajudou a resolver o problema rapidamente. (His proactivity helped resolve the issue quickly.)

when_to_say: When referring to the consequences or effects of an event or action
example: Exemplo 146: A repercussão da notícia foi imediata. (The repercussion of the news was immediate.)

when_to_say: When describing something that bubbles or fizzes, or when referring to a lively, energetic personality
example: Exemplo 147: Sua personalidade é efervescente e contagiante. (Her personality is effervescent and contagious.)

when_to_say: When referring to the conditions or facts affecting a situation
example: Exemplo 148: As circunstâncias não permitiram que ele comparecesse. (The circumstances didn't allow him to attend.)

when_to_say: When referring to a difficult or unfavorable situation
example: Exemplo 149: Ele superou muitas adversidades na vida. (He overcame many adversities in life.)

when_to_say: When describing something that presents a challenge or difficulty
example: Exemplo 150: Esse projeto é bastante desafiante. (This project is quite challenging.)

when_to_say: When referring to the ability to maintain or support something over the long term
example: Exemplo 151: A sustentabilidade ambiental é crucial para o futuro. (Environmental sustainability is crucial for the future.)

when_to_say: When referring to the state of being free from control or influence
example: Exemplo 152: A independência do Brasil foi declarada em 1822. (Brazil's independence was declared in 1822.)

when_to_say: When referring to the process of becoming aware of something
example: Exemplo 153: A conscientização sobre o aquecimento global é fundamental. (Awareness about global warming is fundamental.)

when_to_say: When something is difficult or impossible to understand
example: Exemplo 154: O comportamento dele foi incompreensível. (His behavior was incomprehensible.)

when_to_say: When referring to personal perspectives or feelings that may differ from others
example: Exemplo 155: A subjetividade da arte torna cada interpretação única. (The subjectivity of art makes each interpretation unique.)

when_to_say: When something is so memorable that it cannot be forgotten
example: Exemplo 156: A viagem foi inesquecível. (The trip was unforgettable.)

when_to_say: When referring to the unwillingness to accept views, beliefs, or behavior that differ from one's own
example: Exemplo 157: A intolerância religiosa é um problema grave. (Religious intolerance is a serious problem.)

when_to_say: When referring to how well someone does in an activity or task
example: Exemplo 158: O desempenho da equipe foi excelente. (The team's performance was excellent.)

when_to_say: When referring to a custom or belief that is passed down through generations
example: Exemplo 159: A tradição de celebrar o Natal é forte na minha família. (The tradition of celebrating Christmas is strong in my family.)

when_to_say: When referring to the process of improvement or growth
example: Exemplo 160: O desenvolvimento da cidade está em crescimento. (The development of the city is growing.)

when_to_say: When referring to the process of adjusting to new conditions
example: Exemplo 161: A adaptação ao novo ambiente de trabalho foi rápida. (The adaptation to the new work environment was quick.)

when_to_say: When referring to the process of introducing new ideas, methods, or products
example: Exemplo 162: A inovação tecnológica está mudando o mercado. (Technological innovation is changing the market.)

when_to_say: When referring to the ability to recover quickly from difficulties
example: Exemplo 163: Sua resiliência foi fundamental para superar os obstáculos. (Her resilience was essential to overcome the obstacles.)

when_to_say: When referring to something or someone vanishing or ceasing to exist
example: Exemplo 164: O avião desapareceu do radar. (The plane disappeared from the radar.)

when_to_say: When referring to someone who refuses to compromise or change their position
example: Exemplo 165: Ele foi intransigente na negociação e não cedeu. (He was intransigent in the negotiation and did not give in.)

when_to_say: When referring to the principle of treating all people or situations fairly and without bias
example: Exemplo 166: O juiz demonstrou imparcialidade durante o julgamento. (The judge demonstrated impartiality during the trial.)

when_to_say: When referring to statements or actions that oppose each other or cannot be true at the same time
example: Exemplo 167: As duas declarações eram contraditórias. (The two statements were contradictory.)

when_to_say: When referring to openness and clarity, especially in business or governance
example: Exemplo 168: A transparência é essencial para a confiança pública. (Transparency is essential for public trust.)

when_to_say: When referring to the ability to grasp the meaning of something
example: Exemplo 169: A compreensão do texto é importante para a prova. (The understanding of the text is important for the exam.)

when_to_say: When referring to the act of focusing on something
example: Exemplo 170: Preciso de sua atenção para resolver este problema. (I need your attention to solve this problem.)

when_to_say: When referring to the way someone performs a task or job
example: Exemplo 171: O desempenho da equipe foi excelente durante o jogo. (The team's performance was excellent during the game.)

when_to_say: When referring to the ability to produce a desired result
example: Exemplo 172: A eficácia do remédio foi comprovada. (The efficacy of the medicine was proven.)

when_to_say: When referring to something that cannot be foreseen or predicted
example: Exemplo 173: O tempo é imprevisível nesta época do ano. (The weather is unpredictable at this time of year.)

when_to_say: When referring to the ability to maintain or support something over the long term, especially in environmental contexts
example: Exemplo 174: A sustentabilidade ambiental é crucial para o futuro do planeta. (Environmental sustainability is crucial for the future of the planet.)

when_to_say: When referring to something that cannot be undone or changed
example: Exemplo 175: O dano causado à floresta é irreversível. (The damage caused to the forest is irreversible.)

when_to_say: When referring to someone or something that does not rely on others for support or resources
example: Exemplo 176: A empresa é autossuficiente em termos de energia. (The company is self-sufficient in terms of energy.)

when_to_say: When referring to the mutual reliance between two or more entities
example: Exemplo 177: A interdependência entre países aumenta com a globalização. (The interdependence between countries increases with globalization.)

when_to_say: When referring to the act of taking initiative or anticipating future problems
example: Exemplo 178: A proatividade da equipe foi fundamental para o sucesso do projeto. (The proactivity of the team was crucial to the success of the project.)

meaning: Longing or missing something or someone
when_to_say: When expressing the feeling of missing someone or something, often with a sense of nostalgia
example: Exemplo 179: Sinto muita saudade de minha família. (I feel a lot of longing for my family.)

when_to_say: When talking about the ability to recover quickly from difficulties or challenges
example: Exemplo 180: Sua resiliência o ajudou a superar todos os obstáculos. (His resilience helped him overcome all obstacles.)

when_to_say: When referring to active participation or engagement in an activity or situation
example: Exemplo 181: O envolvimento da equipe foi crucial para o sucesso do projeto. (The involvement of the team was crucial to the success of the project.)

when_to_say: When talking about the effectiveness of producing results or work
example: Exemplo 182: A produtividade aumentou após a implementação das novas ferramentas. (Productivity increased after the implementation of the new tools.)

when_to_say: When describing something that causes a significant change or interruption, often in a market or system
example: Exemplo 183: A tecnologia disruptiva mudou a forma como as empresas operam. (Disruptive technology changed the way businesses operate.)

when_to_say: When referring to the ability to do something well, without wasting time or resources
example: Exemplo 184: A eficiência do sistema aumentou a produção na fábrica. (The efficiency of the system increased production in the factory.)

when_to_say: When referring to the ability to predict future events or behaviors
example: Exemplo 185: A previsibilidade dos resultados é importante para o planejamento estratégico. (The predictability of outcomes is important for strategic planning.)

when_to_say: When referring to a complete change in form, appearance, or character
example: Exemplo 186: A transformação digital está revolucionando o mercado de trabalho. (Digital transformation is revolutionizing the job market.)

when_to_say: When describing something that can be maintained or continued over the long term without damaging the environment or society
example: Exemplo 187: A agricultura sustentável ajuda a preservar os recursos naturais. (Sustainable agriculture helps preserve natural resources.)

when_to_say: When referring to the process of creating new methods, ideas, or products that improve upon existing ones
example: Exemplo 188: A inovação é o motor do crescimento econômico. (Innovation is the engine of economic growth.)
